body_html:
@SsnL I think I was confusing the uppercase MM with the lowercase mm.

I was trying to replicate this code which works in Lua with Torch7:

self.output:mm(x_flat, x_flat:t())

But it seems that I get an error message:

self.output = self.output.mm(x_flat, x_flat.t()) 

self.output = self.output.mm(x_flat, x_flat.t())
TypeError: mm() takes 1 positional argument but 2 were given
body_text:
@SsnL I think I was confusing the uppercase MM with the lowercase mm.
I was trying to replicate this code which works in Lua with Torch7:
 self.output:mm(x_flat, x_flat:t())
But it seems that I get an error message:
self.output = self.output.mm(x_flat, x_flat.t()) 
self.output = self.output.mm(x_flat, x_flat.t())
TypeError: mm() takes 1 positional argument but 2 were given
body:
@SsnL I think I was confusing the uppercase `MM` with the lowercase `mm`.

     

I was trying to replicate this code which works in Lua with Torch7: 

` self.output:mm(x_flat, x_flat:t())`

But it seems that I get an error message: 

`self.output = self.output.mm(x_flat, x_flat.t())
`
```
self.output = self.output.mm(x_flat, x_flat.t())
TypeError: mm() takes 1 positional argument but 2 were given
```
